text: The 1990 UC Davis football team represented the University of California, Davis in the 1990 NCAA Division II football season. UC Davis competed in the Northern California Athletic Conference (NCAC). The Aggies were led by second- year head coach Bob Foster and played their home games at Toomey Field. UC Davis finished the season as champion of the NCAC for the 20th consecutive season. They stretched their conference winning streak to 51 games, dating back to the 1981 season. The Aggies record was seven wins and three losses (7–3, 5–0 NCAC). This was the 21st consecutive year UC Davis finished with a winning record. The team outscored their opponents 234–166 for the season. ==Schedule== ==NFL Draft== The following UC Davis Aggies players were selected in the 1991 NFL Draft. {|class="wikitable" width="65%" |- align="center" style="background:#A81933;color:#FFFFFF;" | Player || Position || Round || Overall || NFL team |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Jeff Bridewell || Quarterback || 12 || 309 || Phoenix Cardinals |} ==Notes== ==References== UC Davis Category:UC Davis Aggies football seasons Category:Northern California Athletic Conference football champion seasons UC Davis Aggies football
